Module lanat
Package lanat.helpRepresentation

Class HelpFormatter

java.lang.Object
lanat.helpRepresentation.HelpFormatter
public class HelpFormatter extends Object
Manager for generating the help message of a command. It is possible to customize the layout of the help message by overriding the initLayout() method.

The layout is a list of LayoutItem objects, which are used to generate the help message. Each LayoutItem has a layout generator, which is a function that may take a Command as parameter and returns a string.

To generate the help message, use generate(Command).

See Also:
  • LayoutItem

  • Method Details

    • setIndentSize

      public static void setIndentSize(int indentSize)
      Sets the indent size to the specified value. The indent size is the number of spaces that are used to indent lines in the help message. The default value is 3.

      The indent size must be between 0 and 10.

      Parameters:
      indentSize - the new indent size

    • getIndentSize

      public static int getIndentSize()
      Returns the indent size.
      Returns:
      the indent size

    • setLineWrapMax

      public static void setLineWrapMax(int lineWrapMax)
      Sets the maximum length of a line in the help message to the specified value. When a line exceeds this length, it is wrapped to the next line.
      Parameters:
      lineWrapMax - the new maximum length of a line

    • getLineWrapMax

      public static int getLineWrapMax()
      Returns the maximum length of a line in the help message.
      Returns:
      the maximum length of a line in the help message

    • getRepresentation

      @NotNull public static @NotNull String getRepresentation(@NotNull @NotNull NamedWithDescription obj)
      Returns the representation of the object specified. This will call the appropriate method from the CommandRepr, ArgumentRepr or GroupRepr classes. If the object is not a command, argument or argument group, the name of the object will be returned.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to get the representation from
      Returns:
      the representation of the object
